newsitem.title: MAURITIUS: Foreign investors boost Mauritius bourse trading.
newsitem.headline: Foreign investors boost Mauritius bourse trading.

text.p: The Mauritius bourse market index rose 0.38 points to 322.09 on Friday as foreign buying boosted volume, bourse officials said.
Turnover surged to 18.60 million rupees on 1,124,096 shares from 3.41 million rupees on 154,912 shares on Wednesday.
"Foreigners heavily bought State Bank of Mauritius and New Mauritius Hotels today," one bourse official said.
"The ensuing share price rises were enough to offset the other falling stocks on the market with the net result that the index moved slightly up," he added.

State Bank of Mauritius gained 10 cents to 8.50 rupees on 713,500 shares and New Mauritius Hotels added 10 cents to 28 rupees on 305,737 shares. These two stocks accounted for more than three quarter of the volume traded on Friday.
Mauritius Commercial Bank was unchanged at 73 rupees on 23,976 shares. Mauritius Breweries lost one rupee to 124 on 100 shares.
Mauritius Chemical Fertilisers Industry fell by 60 cents to 10.20 rupees on 375 shares. Mauritius Oil Refineries rose 20 cents to 8.30 rupees on 2,311 shares.
Mauritius Stationery Manufacturers (MSM) slipped 2.70 rupees to 49.30 on 950 shares.
Investment-based Promotion And Development (PAD) gained 20 cents to 16 rupees on 8,288 shares and Fincorp was unchanged at 73.50 rupees on 1,345 shares.
Mauritius Development Investment Trust climbed 10 cents to 7.60 rupees on 11,428 shares and sugar-based Mon Tresor Mon Desert added 40 cents to 33.10 rupees on 100 shares.
Conglomerates Rogers eased by one rupee to 92 on 14,335 shares but Ireland Blyth was 40 cents higher to 13.40 rupees on 600 shares.
Oil concern Shell (Mauritius) surged by 60 cents to 16 rupees on 300 shares while national carrier Air Mauritius was down 50 cents to 50.50 rupees on 2,336 shares.
